main event: A witness observed a cigar-shaped object in the sky over Kings Park, Long Island, NY on May 24, 1957.
interesting points: The object was observed for 1 and a half minutes and appeared to be slowly moving south., The object had no visible wings or tail assembly and left no exhaust or vapor trail., The object's size was estimated to be between a nickel and a quarter at arm's length., The object changed shape from cigar-shaped to circular during the last 10 seconds of observation., The witness shouted to a coworker who was able to see the object as well.
location: Kings Park, Long Island, NY, USA
witness description: Edmond B. McCabe, working on a high tension line
